## Why write a protocol?

-   Promotes transparency and reduces bias
-   Pre-defines methods before seeing results
-   Enables reproducibility and future updates
-   Encourages collaboration and registration (e.g., PROSPERO, OSF)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Key Protocol Components

| Section | What it covers |
|--------------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **1. Title & Authors** | Project title, team, affiliations |
| **2. Background** | Context and rationale for the review/map |
| **2a. Theory of change** | Conceptual model of how the interventions lead to (desired) outcomes |
| **3. Objectives** | Research question using a structured framework (e.g. PICO, PECO) |
| **4. Eligibility Criteria** | Inclusion/exclusion: study types, settings, populations, outcomes |
| **5. Search Strategy** | Databases, grey literature, keywords, Boolean logic |

## 

| Section | What it covers |
|--------------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **6. Screening Process** | Title/abstract and full-text screening, tools (e.g. Rayyan, EPPI Reviewer) |
| **7. Data Coding / Extraction** | What data will be extracted, coding framework, piloting |
| **8. Study Mapping / Synthesis** | How data will be described (charts, tables, EGMs), etc. |
| **9. Critical Appraisal** | Optional in maps, but state if/how study quality will be assessed |
| **10. Stakeholder Engagement** | If and how you’ll consult users, policymakers, practitioners |

## 

| Section | What it covers |
|--------------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **11. Timeline & Roles** | Who does what, and when |
| **12. Conflicts of Interest** | Declare funding, conflicts, and ethical considerations |

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Example Objective {visibility="hidden"}

> “To systematically map the evidence on the impacts of school feeding programs on nutritional, educational, and social outcomes among children in low- and middle-income countries.”

-   Framework: **PICO**
-   Outcomes of interest: stunting, school attendance, learning outcomes
-   Settings: LMICs, schools

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Protocol Registration

Where to register your protocol:

-   [PROSPERO](https://www.crd.york.ac.uk/prospero/) (mostly health)
-   [OSF](https://osf.io/) (any discipline)
-   [CABI protocolRxiv](https://www.cabidigitallibrary.org/product/ep)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Your Turn {visibility="hidden"}

Spend some time looking at protocols on [CABI protocolRxiv](https://www.cabidigitallibrary.org/product/ep).

Then sketch out:

-   Your **review/map objective**
-   Your **PICO/PECO question**
-   Your **inclusion/exclusion criteria**
-   One database and **search term set**

We'll discuss and refine together.
